class  Header

Detailed Description

DataConnProfileStorage defines an interface to a storage for DataConnProfile objects. It is used by DataConnProfileManager to store and retrieve DataConnProfile settings. DataConnProfileStorage functionality will be used exclusively by DataConnProfileManager. DataConnProfileManager will also control access to DataConnProfileStorage - only one context will access DataConnProfileStorage functionality at a time. In order to avoid dependencies on specifics of storing the profiles, APOXI does not provide an implementation of profile storage. Prototypic implementation can be obtained from COMNEON.

Member Function Documentation

virtual void DataConnProfileStorage::Close (   )  [inline, virtual]
 

Close is called to shut down the profile storage. No read or write operations will be done after closing the storage device.

Reimplemented in FfsDataConnProfileStorage.

virtual BOOLEAN DataConnProfileStorage::Open (  void   )  [inline, virtual]
 

Open is called to initialize the profile storage. After successful open operation, data can be read from and written to the profile storage.

Reimplemented in FfsDataConnProfileStorage.

virtual BOOLEAN DataConnProfileStorage::Read (  INT  recno,
PersistDataConnProfile &  pdcp
)  [inline, virtual]
 

Read receives the profile with record number recno from the profile storage. Record numbers range from 0 to DataConnManager::c_data_conn_profile_count - 1.

Reimplemented in FfsDataConnProfileStorage.

virtual BOOLEAN DataConnProfileStorage::Read (  Header &  header  )  [inline, virtual]
 

Read reads the header from the profile storage. If data has been read successfully TRUE is returned. If data is read for the first time, then the header must be initialized according to the default constructor of class Header.

BOOLEAN DataConnProfileStorage::ResetToFactoryDefaults (   )  [virtual]
 

ResetToFactoryDefaults clears the profile storage and resets its values to factory defaults. Operation can only be applied if the profile storage is in open state. The default implementation clears the header to default values (i.e. deletes all DataConnProfiles).

virtual BOOLEAN DataConnProfileStorage::Write (  INT  recno,
const PersistDataConnProfile &  pdcp
)  [inline, virtual]
 

Write saves profile data to record number recno. Record numbers range from 0 to DataConnManager::c_data_conn_profile_count - 1.

Reimplemented in FfsDataConnProfileStorage.

virtual BOOLEAN DataConnProfileStorage::Write (  const Header &  header  )  [inline, virtual]
 

Write writes header information to the profile storage. It is assumed that the write operation is synchronous.
